definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head

sentences.english: The barbecue shop doing quite well, come here to eat barbecue or pretty much.
sentences.chinese: 烤肉的味道都蠻不錯的，尤其喜歡喫叉燒還有烤腸。

sentences.english: "He's no common man, Barbecue, " said the coxswain to me.
sentences.chinese: ‘大叉燒’，他是個不同尋常的人，”舵手對我說。

sentences.english: Bore a meat good gone bore you.
Roasted duck, bbq pork, marinated chicken.
If you give me the role of a pervert in "Human Flesh Bun", I would be very excited.
sentences.chinese: 你給我一個“人肉叉燒飽”的變態角色我會很興奮。

sentences.english: Cha siu baau is a typical part of the varied Dim Sum dishes.
sentences.chinese: 叉燒包是衆多點心中比較經典的一款。

sentences.english: Pork, Beef, Chicken, Shrimp or Vegetable.
sentences.chinese: 叉燒，牛肉，雞肉，鮮蝦或素菜。

definition: shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒麥|烧麦[shao1 mai4]
rice noodle roll, a roll made from sheets of rice flour dough, steamed and stuffed with meat, vegetables etc
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
